amendment.description: Amendment sought to provide that a state may allow, by special permit, the operation of vehicles with a gross vehicle weight of up to 95,000 pounds for the hauling of livestock and also sought to limit the cost of a special permit to $200 per year for such livestock trailers.
amendment.purpose: An amendment numbered 39 printed in Part B of House Report 114-325 to provide that a state may allow, by special permit, the operation of vehicles with a gross vehicle weight of up to 95,000 pounds for the hauling of livestock. The cost of a special permit may not exceed $200 per year for a livestock trailer.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Rooney (FL) amendment (A038) Failed by recorded vote: 185 - 240 (Roll no. 595).

action.text: Amendment (A038) offered by Mr. Rooney (FL) to the Rules amendment (A001).
Amendment failed in Committee of the Whole
